Package lib.interfaces

Interface BinaryTreeADT<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements stored in the binary tree
All Known Subinterfaces:
BinarySearchTreeADT<T>, HeapADT<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayBinarySearchTree, ArrayBinaryTree, ArrayHeap, LinkedBinarySearchTree, LinkedBinaryTree, LinkedHeap
public interface BinaryTreeADT<T>
Represents a generic abstract data type (ADT) for a binary tree. This interface defines the essential operations that any binary tree implementation must support, such as traversal, element retrieval, and structural queries.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean contains​(T target)
    Checks if the specified target element exists in the binary tree.
    T find​(T target)
    Searches for the specified target element in the binary tree and returns it if found.
    BinaryTreeNode<T> getRoot()
    Retrieves the root node of the binary tree.
    T getRootElement()
    Retrieves the element stored in the root node of the binary tree.
    boolean isEmpty()
    Checks whether the binary tree contains no elements.
    java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorInOrder()
    Returns an iterator that performs an in-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree.
    java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorLevelOrder()
    Returns an iterator that performs a level-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree.
    java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorPostOrder()
    Returns an iterator that performs a post-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree.
    java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorPreOrder()
    Returns an iterator that performs a pre-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree.
    int size()
    Returns the total number of nodes in the binary tree.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of the binary tree.

  • Method Details

    • getRoot

      BinaryTreeNode<T> getRoot()
      Retrieves the root node of the binary tree.
      Returns:
      the root node of the binary tree, or null if the tree is empty

    • getRootElement

      T getRootElement()
      Retrieves the element stored in the root node of the binary tree.
      Returns:
      the element held by the root node of the binary tree

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the binary tree contains no elements.
      Returns:
      true if the binary tree is empty, false otherwise

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the total number of nodes in the binary tree.
      Returns:
      the number of nodes present in the binary tree

    • contains

      boolean contains​(T target) throws EmptyCollectionException, ElementNotFoundException
      Checks if the specified target element exists in the binary tree.
      Parameters:
      target - the element to search for in the binary tree
      Returns:
      true if the target element exists in the binary tree, false otherwise
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the binary tree is empty
      ElementNotFoundException - if the target element is not found in the binary tree

    • find

      T find​(T target) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Searches for the specified target element in the binary tree and returns it if found.
      Parameters:
      target - the element to be searched within the binary tree
      Returns:
      the target element if it is found in the binary tree
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the target element is not found in the binary tree

    • toString

      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the binary tree. The returned string provides a textual representation of the tree's structure and elements.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the binary tree

    • iteratorInOrder

      java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorInOrder()
      Returns an iterator that performs an in-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree. In-order traversal processes the nodes of a binary tree in the order: left subtree, root node, and then the right subtree.
      Returns:
      an iterator of type T that traverses the binary tree in in-order

    • iteratorPreOrder

      java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorPreOrder()
      Returns an iterator that performs a pre-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree. Pre-order traversal processes the nodes of a binary tree in the order: root node, left subtree, and then the right subtree.
      Returns:
      an iterator of type T that traverses the binary tree in pre-order

    • iteratorPostOrder

      java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorPostOrder()
      Returns an iterator that performs a post-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree. Post-order traversal processes the nodes of a binary tree in the order: left subtree, right subtree, and then the root node of each subtree.
      Returns:
      an iterator of type T that traverses the binary tree in post-order

    • iteratorLevelOrder

      java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorLevelOrder() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Returns an iterator that performs a level-order traversal on the elements of the binary tree. Level-order traversal processes all nodes at each depth level from left to right before moving to the next level.
      Returns:
      an iterator of type T that traverses the binary tree in level-order
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the binary tree is empty
